policyFindings: Aeromexico accepts pets in cabin (small dogs and cats) and in the hold as checked baggage.
In-cabin allowed species: dogs and cats.
In-cabin maximum weight: up to 9 kg total (pet + carrier).
Carrier requirement: rigid or soft-sided carrier.
Minimum age: pets younger than 8 weeks are not accepted.
Marketing content mentions in-cabin pet travel permitted on flights up to 6 hours; confirm against the policy hub.
Hold transport: larger pets can travel in the hold with an approved kennel, a health certificate, and advance reservation.
Emotional Support Animals: Spanish page indicates ESAs may travel in cabin with medical documentation, a request form, and prior approval; details and route limits not shown and require verification.
Service animals: detailed policy page was not visible during this check; consult the policy hub.
Fees, carrier dimensions, pet quotas, seasonal/breed restrictions, and route/aircraft limits are not shown on overview pages and must be confirmed on the policy hub or with Aeromexico.
Exotic species are not accepted per the Spanish overview page.
notes: The policy hub uses dynamic content that did not render via the retrieval tool; detailed tables (fees, dimensions, breed lists, forms) could not be captured.

Use the policy hub during booking to confirm carrier size limits, time limits, pet quotas, seasonal embargoes, breed restrictions, documentation, and fees; contact Aeromexico if the page does not load.
The Spanish Vuelos con Mascotas page provides concrete limits (9 kg including carrier; 8-week minimum; no exotic species) but is promotional; verify specifics directly with Aeromexico.
ESA acceptance varies by country and route; confirm ESA rules for the exact itinerary, especially for flights touching the United States.
A current, detailed service-animal policy page was not located during this check; refer to the Travel Information hub or contact Aeromexico.

finalDoc.PetPolicySummary: Aeromexico accepts small dogs and cats in the cabin and transports larger dogs and cats in the hold as checked baggage. In-cabin pets: up to 9 kg total (pet + carrier) in a rigid or soft-sided carrier; minimum age 8 weeks. Checked pets: approved kennel, advance reservation, and a valid health certificate required. Emotional support animals may be accepted in cabin with documentation and prior approval; acceptance can vary by route. Exotic species are not accepted. Confirm fees, dimensions, quotas, breed/seasonal restrictions, and route limits directly with Aeromexico.
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary: Aeromexico permits small dogs and cats in cabin (up to 9 kg total with carrier; rigid or soft-sided) and transports larger dogs and cats in the hold with an approved kennel, advance reservation, and a valid health certificate. Pets must be at least 8 weeks old. Emotional support animals may be accepted in cabin with required documentation and prior approval; rules can vary by route. Exotic species are not accepted. Verify fees, carrier dimensions, quotas, and any breed/seasonal or route restrictions with Aeromexico.
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails: Dogs and cats only. Total weight (pet + carrier) up to 9 kg. Carrier may be rigid or soft-sided. Minimum age: 8 weeks. Operator note: Some content suggests a maximum flight duration of 6 hours for in-cabin pets—confirm with Aeromexico.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails: Dogs and cats can travel in the hold as checked baggage with an approved kennel, advance reservation, and a valid health certificate. Operator note: Breed restrictions, aircraft/route limitations, and seasonal temperature embargoes may apply—confirm with Aeromexico.
finalDoc.serviceAnimalDetails: Service animals are accommodated; consult Aeromexico’s travel information for documentation and behavior requirements specific to your route.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails: Approved airline-compliant kennel required; confirm size and specifications with Aeromexico.
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails: Rigid or soft-sided carrier. Total weight (pet + carrier) up to 9 kg.
finalDoc.esaDetails: Emotional support animals may be accepted in the cabin with medical documentation, a request form, and prior approval. Acceptance varies by country and route—verify requirements with Aeromexico before travel.
